articles.description: Clubhouse leader Shane Lowry says his experience of winning the Open Championship at Royal Portrush in 2019 will be "very beneficial" in his bid for a second title at Royal Troon.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Shane Lowry says memories of Portrush win will 'benefit' Troon bid

articles.description: England's day in the dirt during the second Test against West Indies at Trent Bridge is the start of life without James Anderson but they must develop ruthlessness in all facets, says chief cricket writer Stephan Shemilt.
articles.title: England vs West Indies: 'Day in the dirt start of England's life after Anderson'

articles.description: Newcastle United boss Eddie Howe says he is "committed" to the club as long as he is "happy and feels supported", after being linked with replacing Gareth Southgate as England manager.
articles.title: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe 'committed' to club amid England job links

articles.description: Team GB's world champion Kimberley Woods explains why a new event is one of the must-watch contests at Paris 2024.
articles.title: Kayak cross: Kimberley Woods on canoeing's unpredictable Olympic event

articles.description: Chantelle Cameron casts doubt on Katie Taylor trilogy
articles.title: Chantelle Cameron casts doubt on Katie Taylor trilogy

articles.description: Tiger Woods arrived at Royal Troon saying he could contend. He left with only sympathy to show for his efforts, writes Tom English.
articles.title: The Open 2024: Tiger Woods leaves Royal Troon with only low-key sympathy

articles.description: Rob McElhenney chooses between Wrexham winning another promotion or his documentary series winning an Emmy.
articles.title: Wrexham co-owner Rob McElhenney chooses between winning promotion or an Emmy

articles.description: England end France's dominance of the Under-20 World Cup and claim their first title since 2016 with a 21-13 victory in the final.
articles.title: England 21-13 France: England end French dominance to win Under-20 World Cup

articles.description: Rory McIlroy says his failure to cope with the windy conditions which prevailed for much of the first two days at Royal Troon led to his failure to make the cut at the Open Championship.
articles.title: The Open 2024: 'The wind got the better of me' - Rory McIlroy on Troon exit

articles.description: Ferrari’s Carlos Sainz leads Red Bull’s Max Verstappen in first practice at the Hungarian Grand Prix.
articles.title: Hungarian Grand prix 2024: Carlos Sainz of Ferrari tops first practice ahead of Max Verstappen
